titleNullable: Bangladeshi Coin Image Dataset for Classification
subtitleNullable: Improvement of automated classification of Bangladeshi Coin for vending machine.
descriptionNullable:
Title: Bangladeshi Coin Image Dataset for Automated Coin Classification

**In-text citation:**

(Islam et al., 2024)

**Harvard Style Reference: **

Islam, M. A., Birahim, S. A., Saha, P., Nur, A. H., and Hasan, M., (2024) ‘*Bangladeshi Coin Image Dataset for Classification*’. Kaggle. doi: 10.34740/KAGGLE/DSV/8698465.

Overview:
The Bangladeshi Coin Photo Dataset consists of 5760 high-resolution images of 1 taka (tk), 2 taka (tk), and 5 taka (tk) coins. The dataset was created to facilitate the development of automated systems for coin identification, with a specific application in vending machines that currently only accept banknotes. This dataset will support machine learning models aimed at recognizing and processing coin transactions, thereby expanding the functionality of vending machines to accept both coins and banknotes.

Data Collection:

Source: The images were captured by four participants under controlled conditions.
Collection Method: Each participant took photos of coins using a standardized setup to ensure consistency in image quality and angles.
Time Period: The photos were taken over a period from May 5, 2024, to May 27, 2024.

Dataset Structure:

Data Format: JPEG images.
Data Size: 5760 photos, organized in directories by participant and coin type.

Content Description:

Participants: Four individuals, each contributing 1440 photos.
Individual Contributions: Each participant took 1440 photos, including individual and paired coin images.
Coins: Images of 1tk, 2tk, and 5tk coins.
Number of Coins: Each participant photographed 20 coins of each denomination.

Angles and Views:
Individual Coins: Each coin was photographed from 8 different angles for both heads and tails.
Paired Coins: Photos of pairs of coins taken from 8 different angles for both heads and tails.
Total Photos Per Participant: 1440 photos (960 for individual coins, 480 for paired coins).

Limitations:

Data Quality: While efforts were made to standardize photo conditions, variations in lighting and minor positional differences may exist.
Bias: The dataset includes coins in various conditions, which could affect recognition accuracy in real-world applications.

Limitations: The dataset does not include images of coins in circulation with significant wear and tear.
